intro: Calyptromyrcia costata, commonly known as the Costa's calyptromyrcia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes various aromatic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically narrow and leathery in texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink, followed by small, woody fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
